{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.06902v1", "title": "A Measurement Device Independent Quantum Key Distribution protocol in
  the service of three users", "summary": "Quantum Key Distribution (QKD) is the only theoretically proven method for
secure key distribution between two users. In this work, we propose and analyze
a Measurement Device Independent (MDI) protocol designed to distribute keys
among three users in a pairwise manner. Each user randomly selects a basis,
encodes bit values in the phase of coherent states, and sends the resulting
pulses to a central measurement unit (MU) composed of three beam splitters and
three photon detectors. When the three pulses arrive simultaneously at the MU
and under the condition of successful detection of photons, a key bit is
distributed to at least one pair of users. This protocol extends the
foundational phase-encoding MDI protocol introduced by [K. Tamaki, et al.,
Phys. Rev. A 85, 042307 (2012)] to three users, but this comes at the cost of
introducing a systematic error in the implementation of the honest protocol.", "main_category": "quant-ph", "categories": "quant-ph", "published": "2025-04-09T14:01:49Z"}
